Pineapple on pizza is delicious — and if you disagree, you can’t log in to WordPress.orgTechCrunch12/17/2024

There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least. […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

[…] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.",
            "articleBody": "<p id="speakable-summary" class="wp-block-paragraph">There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least.</p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">Users this week <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.404media.co/wordpress-login-pineapple-on-pizza/">reported</a> seeing an extra checkbox on the WordPress.org log-in page, requiring them to agree that “Pineapple is delicious on pizza.”</p>  <img data-reference="image" data-document-id="cms/api/amp/image/AA1w1fj5">  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">It would be easy to chuckle and put this down to festive merriment from the good folks at the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wordpressfoundation.org/">WordPress Foundation</a>, but it’s actually part of the ongoing <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/wordpress-vs-wp-engine-drama-explained/" rel="noreferrer noopener">WordPress vs. WP Engine brouhaha</a> currently playing out in the courts. </p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">WordPress developer Automattic blocked WP Engine from accessing core resources of the open-source project <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/25/wordpress-org-bans-wp-engine-blocks-it-from-accessing-its-resources/">back in September</a>, while also inserting a checkbox requiring users to confirm that they nor affiliated with WP Engine. Last week, a court <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/court-orders-mullenweg-and-automattic-to-restore-wp-engines-access-to-wordpress-org/">ordered Automattic to reverse course</a> on both counts. So now, everyone from freelancers to multinational enterprises must confirm that they like pineapple on pizza instead.</p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">What a time to be alive. </p> <p>© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.</p>"

data-fe-b="1 2"><!--fe-b$$start$$3$$iYJyiNnaVB$$fe-b--><!--fe-b$$start$$0$$iVyAjKapxd$$fe-b--><p id="speakable-summary" class="wp-block-paragraph" data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}"><span class="dropcap-element-slot">T</span>here are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least.</p><div class="intra-article-module" data-t="{"n":"intraArticle","t":13}"><slot name="AA1w11vO-intraArticleModule-0"><div class="intra-article-ad-placeholder"></div></slot></div>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph" data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}">Users this week <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.404media.co/wordpress-login-pineapple-on-pizza/" target="_blank" data-t="{"n":"destination","t":13,"b":1,"c.t":7}">reported</a> seeing an extra checkbox on the WordPress.org log-in page, requiring them to agree that “Pineapple is delicious on pizza.”</p>  <div class="article-image-slot image-slot-placeholder" data-doc-id="cms/api/amp/image/AA1w1fj5"><slot name="AA1w11vO-image-cms/api/amp/image/AA1w1fj5"><div class="common-slot-placeholder"></div></slot></div>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph continue-read-break" data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}">It would be easy to chuckle and put this down to festive merriment from the good folks at the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wordpressfoundation.org/" target="_blank" data-t="{"n":"destination","t":13,"b":1,"c.t":7}">WordPress Foundation</a>, but it’s actually part of the ongoing <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/wordpress-vs-wp-engine-drama-explained/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank" data-t="{"n":"destination","t":13,"b":1,"c.t":7}">WordPress vs. WP Engine brouhaha</a> currently playing out in the courts. <slot name="cont-read-break"></slot></p><div class="intra-article-module" data-t="{"n":"intraArticle","t":13}"><slot name="AA1w11vO-intraArticleModule-1"></slot></div>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph" data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}">WordPress developer Automattic blocked WP Engine from accessing core resources of the open-source project <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/25/wordpress-org-bans-wp-engine-blocks-it-from-accessing-its-resources/" target="_blank" data-t="{"n":"destination","t":13,"b":1,"c.t":7}">back in September</a>, while also inserting a checkbox requiring users to confirm that they nor affiliated with WP Engine. Last week, a court <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/court-orders-mullenweg-and-automattic-to-restore-wp-engines-access-to-wordpress-org/" target="_blank" data-t="{"n":"destination","t":13,"b":1,"c.t":7}">ordered Automattic to reverse course</a> on both counts. So now, everyone from freelancers to multinational enterprises must confirm that they like pineapple on pizza instead.</p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph" data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}">What a time to be alive. </p> <p data-t="{"n":"blueLinks"}">© 2024 TechCrunch. finalizedMeta.title: Pineapple on pizza is delicious — and if you disagree, you can’t log in to WordPress.org
finalizedMeta.description: There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least. […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

jsonLd.headline: Pineapple on pizza is delicious — and if you disagree, you can’t log in to WordPress.org
jsonLd.description: There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least. […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
jsonLd.author: Paul Sawers
jsonLd.articleBody: <p id="speakable-summary" class="wp-block-paragraph">There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least.</p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">Users this week <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.404media.co/wordpress-login-pineapple-on-pizza/">reported</a> seeing an extra checkbox on the WordPress.org log-in page, requiring them to agree that “Pineapple is delicious on pizza.”</p>  <img data-reference="image" data-document-id="cms/api/amp/image/AA1w1fj5">  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">It would be easy to chuckle and put this down to festive merriment from the good folks at the <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wordpressfoundation.org/">WordPress Foundation</a>, but it’s actually part of the ongoing <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/wordpress-vs-wp-engine-drama-explained/" rel="noreferrer noopener">WordPress vs. WP Engine brouhaha</a> currently playing out in the courts. </p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">WordPress developer Automattic blocked WP Engine from accessing core resources of the open-source project <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/25/wordpress-org-bans-wp-engine-blocks-it-from-accessing-its-resources/">back in September</a>, while also inserting a checkbox requiring users to confirm that they nor affiliated with WP Engine. Last week, a court <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/10/court-orders-mullenweg-and-automattic-to-restore-wp-engines-access-to-wordpress-org/">ordered Automattic to reverse course</a> on both counts. So now, everyone from freelancers to multinational enterprises must confirm that they like pineapple on pizza instead.</p>  <p class="wp-block-paragraph">What a time to be alive. </p> <p>© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.</p>
